datafield.subfield: National Capital Area Chapter American Society for Public Administration Records

The National Capital Area Chapter is one of the largest chapters of the American Society for Public Administration. Its membership consists of public servants and managers in the nation’s capital. The Chapter developed the professional journal, the Bureaucrat.
John Stone and Michael Carmichael, former officers in the NCAC-ASPA, donated the records of the National Capital Area Chapter-American Society for Public Administration (NCAC-ASPA) in 1988 and 1989.

The collection includes budgets, financial statements, membership information, newsletters, handbooks, conference materials, annual reports, and meeting minutes from the Society’s office files and past officers of the Society. The collection is divided into series by the origin of the materials as follows: Presidential papers, offices files, and treasurer’s records.
